Parameters: ListView: The ListView where the click happened
View: The view that was clicked within the ListView
int: The position of the view in the list
long: The row id of the item that was clicked
onListItemClick(android.widget.ListView,.Description: This method will be called when an item in the list is selected. Subclasses should override. Subclasses can call getListView().getItemAtPosition(position) if they need to access the data associated with the selected item.
onListItemClick(android.widget.ListView,.FullName: protected void onListItemClick (ListView l, View v, int position, long id)

setTitle(int).Description: Change the title associated with this activity. If this is a top-level activity, the title for its window will change. If it is an embedded activity, the parent can do whatever it wants with it.

Parameters: int: The item whose Intent to return
intentForPosition(int).Description: Return the actual Intent for a specific position in our @B_android#widget#ListView_E@.

onQueryPackageManager(android.content.In.Description: Perform query on package manager for list items. The default implementation queries for activities.

onSetContentView().Description: Override to call setContentView() with your own content view to customize the list layout.

getTargetIntent().Description: Get the base intent to use when running @B_android#content#pm#PackageManager#queryIntentActivities_E@.

setTitle(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Change the title associated with this activity. If this is a top-level activity, the title for its window will change. If it is an embedded activity, the parent can do whatever it wants with it.

itemForPosition(int).Description: Return the @B_android#app#LauncherActivity#ListItem_E@ for a specific position in our @B_android#widget#ListView_E@.

makeListItems().Description: Perform the query to determine which results to show and return a list of them.

Parameters: Bundle: If the activity is being re-initialized after previously being shut down then this Bundle contains the data it most recently supplied in @B_android#app#Activity#onSaveInstanceState_E@. Note: Otherwise it is null. This value may be null.
onCreate(android.os.Bundle).Description: Called when the activity is starting. This is where most initialization should go: calling @B_android#app#Activity#setContentView_E@ to inflate the activity's UI, using @B_android#app#Activity#findViewById_E@ to programmatically interact with widgets in the UI, calling @B_android#app#Activity#managedQuery_E@ to retrieve cursors for data being displayed, etc. You can call @B_android#app#Activity#finish_E@ from within this function, in which case onDestroy() will be immediately called after @B_android#app#Activity#onCreate_E@ without any of the rest of the activity lifecycle (@B_android#app#Activity#onStart_E@, @B_android#app#Activity#onResume_E@, @B_android#app#Activity#onPause_E@, etc) executing. Derived classes must call through to the super class's implementation of this method. If they do not, an exception will be thrown. This method must be called from the If you override this method you must call through to the superclass implementation.

ClassDesc: Displays a list of all activities which can be performed for a given intent. Launches when clicked.
